title: Seqimp align step failing for some extreme fastq files
body:
Hi,
when aligning a file in which the vast majority of reads map to a single Ensembl category and all other categories have less then 1% of the reads each, Seqimp "align" gives the following error:

```
Error in rowSums(x) : 'x' must be an array of at least two dimensions
Calls: unlist -> lapply -> FUN -> rowSums
Execution halted
QC plotting (boxBowtie_QC) hasn't worked: R --vanilla --slave --args --input=/path/to/seqimp/ENCODE_sRNA/132//BOWTIE/ --output=/path/to/seqimp/ENCODE_sRNA/132//QC/ --basicID=132 --grangesClass=/path/to/seqimp_annotation/Annotation_8917/ENSEMBL/human_1//GRangesObjects//human_1.annotation.classes.RData --chrTypes=/path/to/seqimp_annotation/Annotation_8917/ENSEMBL/human_1//Genome//human_1.chrom_class.tab --procSummary=/path/to/seqimp/ENCODE_sRNA/132//PROCESSED//total.saved.trimmit.tab --maxHits=20  < seqimp-15-075/bin/boxBowtie_QC.R:
```

The error can be reproduced with the following fastq file:
http://hgdownload.cse.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/hg19/encodeDCC/wgEncodeCshlShortRnaSeq/wgEncodeCshlShortRnaSeqMcf7CellShorttotalRawDataRep3.fastq.gz

title: Feature request: Providing paths to binaries other then $PATH
body:
Hi,
it would be very useful is the user could specify at run time (e.g. through environment variables) the path to the binaries used by the pipeline, such as R, samtools, bowtie, etc...
This would allow to run seqimp using a specific version of each dependency.

thanks
tom

title: miR_table.R terminates with an error
body:
miR_table.R (run by the _features_ step of the pipeline) fails to complete and reports the following error:
```
Identifying overlapping miRBase annotation
Error in .local(query, subject, maxgap, minoverlap, type, select, ...) : 
  unused argument (ignoreSelf = TRUE)
Calls: findOverlaps ... findOverlaps -> .local -> findOverlaps -> findOverlaps
Execution halted
```
